findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: The contract owner can upgrade the script without restrictions, potentially allowing unauthorized changes.

findings.title: Unsecured constructor
findings.description: The constructor of the contract is public and unsecured, allowing anyone to call it.

findings.title: Unprotected public functions
findings.description: The ERC20 contract has unprotected public functions (name, symbol, decimals, totalSupply, balanceOf, transfer, allowance, approve, transferFrom) that can be accessed by anyone.

findings.title: Unprotected internal functions (_transfer, _mint, _burn, _approve, _beforeTokenTransfer)
findings.description: The internal functions _transfer, _mint, _burn, _approve, and _beforeTokenTransfer are unprotected, which can lead to unauthorized access and manipulation of the token's state.
